--- layout: default title: OHBM 2015 ---
This collection organizes a number of different posters and talks from NISOx and NISOx collaborators at the 2015 Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM) in Hawaii, 14-18 June.

Talks

This section lists all available OHBM 2015 standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Fast, accurate methods for heritability and association highdimensional connectomics data
    Author: Thomas Nichols. Genetics of the Connectome Morning Workshop. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5478373.v1
  • Practical Image-Based Meta-Analysis
    Authors: Camille Maumet, Thomas Nichols. Neuroimaging Meta-Analysis Educational Course. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5478376.v1
  • Modelling Time-varying effective Brain Connectivity using Multiregression Dynamic Models
    Author: Thomas Nichols. Estimating Time Varying Connectivity Morning Workshop. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5478379.v1
  • Overview of MetaAnalysis Approaches
    Author: Thomas Nichols. Neuroimaging Meta-Analysis Educational Course. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5478409.v1
  • Reproducibility and Power
    Author: Thomas Nichols. Reproducible Neuroimaging Educational Course. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5478418.v1
  • Family Structure and Heritability
    Author: Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5478367.v1
  • Regression, permutation & prediction analyses
    Author: Thomas Nichols. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5478412.v1

Posters

This section lists all available posters submitted to OHBM 2015 by NISOx and NISOx collaborators. Boldface lettering indicates the day of presentation.
  • 2186-M Spatial Bayesian Latent Factor Regression Modelling of Coordinate-Based Meta-Analysis Data
    Authors: Silvia Montagna, et al.
  • 2189-Tu Spatial point process modelling of coordinate-based meta-analysis data
    Authors: Pantelis Samartsidis, et al.
  • 2192-M A Bayesian Hierarchical Spatial Point Process Model for MS Subtype Classification
    Authors: Bernd Taschler, et al.
  • 3419-Th Accelerated Bivariate Heritability Inference Using the Endophenotype Ranking Value
    Authors: Xu Chen, et al.
  • 3421-Th Accelerated Permutation Inference for Pedigree Heritability Inference with Family-Based Neuroimaging
    Authors: Habib Ganjgahi, et al.
  • 3422-W Massively Expedited Genome-wide Heritability Analysis (MEGHA)
    Authors: Tian Ge, et al.
  • 3428-W Investigation into the heritabilities of some traits in the Human Connectome Project
    Authors: Anderson M. Winkler, et al.
  • 3521-Th Standardized reporting of neuroimaging results with NIDM in SPM, FSL and AFNI
    Authors: Camille Maumet, et al.
  • 3754-W Rich Block: Rich Club Analysis with the Erdos-Renyi Mixture Model
    Authors: Soroosh Afyouni, et al.
  • 3801-Th Dynamic Effective Connectivity Modelling with Multiregression Dynamic Models
    Authors: Ruth Harbord, et al.
  • 3861-Th Generalised Linear Stochastic Blockmodelling and Inference in Multi-Subject Networks
    Authors: Dragana M. Pavlovic, et al.
  • 4033-Th Prospective power estimation for peak inference with the toolbox neuropower
    Authors: Joke Durnez, et al.
  • 4034-W Threshold-Free Cluster Enhancement revisited: Increasing Power and Spatial specificity of TFCE
    Authors: Habib Ganjgahi, et al.
  • 4035-Th Non-parametric Inference for Longitudinal and Repeated-Measures Neuroimaging Data with the Wild Bootstrap
    Authors: Bryan Guillaume, et al.
  • 4036-W Do the units matter? Validity of Intensity Based MetaAnalysis in the presence of unit mismatches
    Authors: Camille Maumet, et al.
  • 4038-W Estimating the prevalence of file drawer studies in coordinate-based meta-analysis
    Authors: Pantelis Samartsidis, et al.

Courses

This section lists all available OHBM 2015 courses created by or contributed towards by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Harmonise This! Analyzing Diverse Neuroimaging Datasets
  • Introduction to Imaging Genetics educational course
